title: Helping bronze players improve. ep 5

embed.description: This is part of a series, where I try and help others go from Bronze to silver. Heck maybe even gold. Im not the one playing, Im spectating a game. If you are bronze and want some help, let me know.

body:
God watching these guys makes my head spin XD
I may or may not get a little mad at the guy.

replies.body: As a darius main I cringed so hard XD, I think I'm friends with that guy. Nice work tutoring!

lol im trying XD
He ends up not listening to me (In ep 6)
But hes a chilled guy anyway.

There's really not that great of a difference between bronze/silver/gold, especially in OCE. 
The main thing is just warding, map awareness etc. Many players in bronze, mechanics-wise, are on par with players much higher ranked, they just make stupid decisions like pushing hard without wards, bad tower dives, etc. 
A sure-fire way to get higher ranked, which worked to get me to Gold I (I am about silver, skill-wise), is to literally suck dick. Whoever's doing well on your team, compliment them, be supportive when they die, and just ride them all game. Theres a psychological effect in humans that literally will make your team play better, because subconsciously they want more compliments and they want to prove that they're as good as YOU'RE saying they are. This really does go a long way. 
Also, finally, play like a bitch. Don't get into stupid trades, farm well, if you see someone low health running into their jungle, let them go. If someone on your team decides to dive in 1v5, let them die, back up. You could try to be the hero that flash ults into stupid situations, or you could just...not. High risk plays like that only reward highly skilled players (99% of the time) --- and frankly anyone in bronze just isn't amazing at the game (which is not a big deal at all i'm not trying to like talk down to anyone, just being honest).

TL;DR   -   Ride dicks, play like a bitch.
